item.title: Report E-2024070110
item.description:
Report E-2024070110

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: MARION
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 33ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that five (5) gallons of material was released due to crushed freight due to hard braking damaging twelve (12) plastic bottles. First Call personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and then used a granular absorbent to gather the neutralized material. The spent absorbents were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and the damaged bottles were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was transported to the nearest ESTES terminal. The damaged bottles were then combined with the spent absorbents. The 55-gallon poly drum was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor’s demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: We found it on the rollers between door 17 and 18 as it had been put with the regular closures during the sort. The box was already dry when we received it, but we had not found any other boxes that it had leaked on to. There were two jugs of Zep industrial degreaser and one of them had no cap, so the degreaser had leaked out at some point.

item.title: Report E-2024070426
item.description:
Report E-2024070426

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that an unknown quantity of Urkisol 500 released from several 1-gallon metal cans impacting the pallet and trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with absorbents if necessary and place the contents into a 55-gallon metal drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070400
item.description:
Report E-2024070400

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: PARMA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to unknown reasons, approximately 2-gallons of Tremco Puma TC (hazardous - UN1866) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged pail, and oil-dri was placed into a 10-gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report I-2024070057
item.description:
Report I-2024070057

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: Defiance
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was scheduled to delvier a shipment of Ferric Chloride to Defiance Water in Defiance, OH. The driver arrived on site, proceeded to the offloading location, and hooked up to the customers tank. During the offload the customer's PVC piping failed resulting in 20 gallons of Ferric Chloride to be released within containment.

item.title: Report I-2024060050
item.description:
Report I-2024060050

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-20
  • City: EMPIRE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HERITAGE TRANSPORT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A release was observed from the nose of a drum trailer. The source was investigated and discovered to originate from two 5-gallon containers that had fallen onto their sides during transport. The release was contained to prevent additional loss of material. Both containers were overpacked and clean up residuals were placed into new containers.

item.title: Report E-2024070337
item.description:
Report E-2024070337

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal BCO experienced a UN2924 Silquest A-1101 Silane release from a 330-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 ounces of product released to the metal tote body only. The plug on the top of the tote was missing which caused the release. The hole was plugged and a slosh test was completed which determined there would be no further release. The tote was wiped down, confirmed neutral, and confirmed secured for shipment on. The impacted pads and PPE were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024070320
item.description:
Report E-2024070320

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-09
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 9, 2024, three (3) 50-pound bags of UN3190 were torn and released approximately five (5) pounds of product to the trailer interior and loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel overpacked the damaged bags in one (1) 95-gallon drum. Crews utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate teh site and collected all impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report I-2024070004
item.description:
Report I-2024070004

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-22
  • City: GRAFTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FREEHOLD CARTAGE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2100
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Checking the transfer line, the associate noticed Van 53022 (FCI) was leaking onto the gravel. The associate notified the foreman and pulled the van onto the concrete roadway to get it off the gravel. We assessed the area and then we took the van to the CSF to be offloaded to find the leaking container. About halfway in the trailer we found the drum with a dime size hole in it and the contents had all leaked onto the trailer floor except for approx. 15 gal. We finished unloading the van and we processed the load. We cleaned the trailer floor with floor dry. We also cleaned the TL and the drive. The material that leaked onto the drive stained the concrete. The Transfer Line spill on the gravel was approx. 1 gal. it was contained in a 3 foot radius pot hole so we added floor dry to absorb the material. We took a before and after sample to the lab with the cin. (519142) we used on the drum that leaked. All effected areas have been cleaned. We generated 1 (1/4 Full) Tote. Tote is labeled with a Haz. Label with the info. needed and placed in the on hold area.
